intro: Caulotretus heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable leaf tephrothamnus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its diverse leaf morphology, which varies significantly across different parts of the plant. The species typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered in heads, typical of the Asteraceae family, and it produces achene fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
